intro: Auriculardisia eucuneata, commonly known as the auriculate daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
